title: Cannot set default compiler in packages.yaml
body:
In the [Spack Configuration Documentation](http://software.llnl.gov/spack/configuration.html#concretization-preferences), it shows an example where you can set the default compiler for a package. However, this doesn't seem to work. Libpciaccess and OpenSSL cannot be built with the PGI compilers. I tried adding the following to my `~/.spack/packages.yaml`:

``` yaml
packages:
  libpciaccess:
    compiler: [gcc, intel, nag]
  openssl:
    compiler: [gcc, intel, nag]
```

The behavior I expect is that if I build `curl`, it will build everything with GCC. If I build `curl %intel`, it will build everything with Intel. And if I build `curl %pgi`, it will build curl with PGI but build OpenSSL with GCC. However, I get this behavior:

```
$ spack spec curl%pgi

  curl@7.49.1%pgi@16.5-0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
      ^openssl@1.0.2h%pgi@16.5-0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
          ^zlib@1.2.8%pgi@16.5-0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
```

Even when I set the default compiler to intel:

``` yaml
packages:
  libpciaccess:
    compiler: [intel]
  openssl:
    compiler: [intel]
```

I get:

```
$ spack spec curl

  curl@7.49.1%gcc@6.1.0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
      ^openssl@1.0.2h%gcc@6.1.0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
          ^zlib@1.2.8%gcc@6.1.0 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
```

If I specifically try to build OpenSSL, then I get the right behavior:

```
$ spack spec openssl

  openssl@1.0.2h%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
      ^zlib@1.2.8%intel@16.0.3 arch=linux-centos6-x86_64
```

But this still doesn't help me solve the problem of trying to build OpenMPI and NetCDF with PGI.
